page.title: 16Nature in Bredfield-Plants.
page.content: These plants can make up a hedge, hawthorn, blackthorn, which gives sloes that people make into wine or sloe gin, buckthorn, dog rose, dogwood and brambles, which give blackberries for jam, puddings and wine. Wild clematis and ivy climb all over these plants as well as the oak, ash and field maple trees growing through the hedge, while underneath grow garlic mustard, called Jack by the hedge, nettles, periwinkle and meadow plants like field pansy and scarlet pimpernel. In the roadside verges grow sheep parsley, hogweed, poppies, alexanders, speedwell, plantains, snowdrops, self heal and thistles. In springtime there are primroses, violets, cowslips and oxslips in ditches and woods, where dog's mercury, bluebells, wood anemones, wild daffodils and orchids also grow.
